column1: Kumher (formerly Kumbher) is a historical city and land of Yaduvanshi Sinsinwars the initial name of this city was Kuber. It is located in Bharatpur district of Rajasthan
Kumher is located at 27.32°N 77.37°E﻿ / 27.32; 77.37. It has an average elevation of 176 metres (577 feet). Kumher is also the birthplace of the illustrious Arya Samaji Vedic and Ayurvedic scholar
Kumher was founded by a Jat chieftain Kumbh. In 1754
column2: when Raja Surajmal of Bharatpur was the king
column3: the fort at Kumher was sieged by the Marathas as Peshwa Balaji Baji Rao's younger brother Raghoba (supported by chieftains Scindias and Holkars) wanted Surajmal to be subservant to them. However
column4: the siege did not succeed. In 1754
column5: on behest of Mughal Emperor Alamgir II
column6: Khanderao laid the seize of Kumher fort of Jat Maharaja Suraj Mal of Bharatpur State who had sided with Alamgir's adversary Siraj ud-Daulah. Khanderao Holkar
column8: was inspecting his troops on an open palanquin in the battle of Kumher when was hit and killed by a cannonball from the Jat army. Marathas (particularly Scindias and Holkars) signed a treaty with Surajmal and withdrew their army. To honor Khanderao
column9: Suraj Mal built a Chhatri on the cremation spot of Khanderao at Kumher.

column5: and female literacy is 40%. In Kumher

column2: Jal Mahal's are in Kumher. Kumher is also part of Braj Bhumi includes Govardhan Parikrima and Punchri Ka Lotha. Famous Temples in Kumer are Satya Narain Mandir
